books.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II

chapters.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:1
verses.text: A Second Epistle of Ignatius to Saint John.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:2
verses.text: His friend Ignatius to John the holy presbyter.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:3
verses.text: If thou wilt give me leave, I desire to go up to Jerusalem, and see the faithful saints who are there, especially Mary the mother, whom they report to be an object of admiration and of affection to all.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:4
verses.text: For who would not rejoice to behold and to address her who bore the true God from her own womb, provided he is a friend of our faith and religion? And in like manner I desire to see the venerable James, who is surnamed Just, whom they relate to be very like Christ Jesus in appearance, in life, and in method of conduct, as if he were a twin-brother of the same womb.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:5
verses.text: They say that, if I see him, I see also Jesus Himself, as to all the features and aspect of His body.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:6
verses.text: Moreover, I desire to see the other saints, both male and female.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to St. John II 1:7
verses.text: Alas! why do I delay? Why am I kept back? Kind teacher, bid me hasten to fulfil my wish, and fare thou well, Amen.
